tweet: .@RealDonaldTrump’s repeated efforts to enlist foreign help in meddling with our country’s elections underscores the urgency for anti-corruption & election security reform. It’s been 200 days since the House passed the #ForThePeopleAct. @SenateMajLdr: Do your job & vote on HR 1.

This lawless approach undermines our ability to conduct meaningful congressional oversight of US refugee policy, which is particularly egregious in light of the global crisis. There are more refugees now than any time since WWII. Trump must abandon his dangerous proposal.

Late last night, Trump again ignored the law by quietly issuing historically low US refugee admissions numbers for 2020 without even consulting Congress, which is required by statute. This is an affront to our nation’s values. https://www.newsweek.com/trump-administration-condemned-slashing-refugee-settlement-admissions-historic-low-1461768 …

If a 19-year-old from Gilroy can cross state lines into Nevada to buy a weapon of war banned in his home state & kill children, California's gun laws alone aren’t sufficient. We must reauthorize the federal #AssaultWeaponsBan to protect all of our communities from gun violence. pic.twitter.com/96LYjlG8b5

After the #GilroyShooting, family-friendly events planned for the weekend were cancelled. People were afraid to leave their homes. Gun violence harms entire communities. Today, @HouseJudiciary held a hearing to review how to make our communities safer from assault weapons. pic.twitter.com/kLOazJkBQS
A formal impeachment inquiry should be undertaken in the House of Representatives. My full statement: pic.twitter.com/noYa3oKOOT

Today @RepBera & I led @HouseJudiciary & @HouseForeign committees’ first ever joint hearing on Trump’s #MuslimBan. This Administration must answer for its discriminatory policy, which has kept families apart for years, & hear from those who were harmed by the chaos they created. pic.twitter.com/V5WM16NSFm

I’m deeply troubled by reports of detentions without due process and communications blockades in Kashmir. The US must speak out against this human rights crisis. This is another politically motivated attack on California for pioneering strong environmental policies. Revoking our right to set tougher auto emission standards is a blow to public health and the will of California voters. https://www.latimes.com/environment/story/2019-09-17/trump-revokes-california-environmental-authority-auto-deal …

High-capacity magazines are banned in CA, but the #GilroyShooting perpetrator still bought them by crossing state lines. Three people would still be alive today if they were banned nationally. @HouseJudiciaryDems & I passed @RepTedDeutch's #KeepAmericansSafe Act to do just that. pic.twitter.com/P5bsOzQWQl

State gun safety laws alone can’t prevent all mass shootings. The #GilroyShooting perpetrator avoided CA gun laws by buying his weapon in Nevada. Proud to support @RepCarbajal & @RepLucyMcBath in their efforts to extend effective state gun laws to the federal level. pic.twitter.com/jt47M0mkvW

The Trump administration has failed to effectively manage the humanitarian crisis at the border as it continues to mistreat families and put them in danger. I will continue to fight in Congress to hold this Administration accountable for its destructive immigration policies.

The President’s “Remain in Mexico” policy forces vulnerable families to stay in dangerous conditions similar to those they fled, all while they are funneled into a chaotic system that can make them miss their asylum hearing through no fault of their own. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-immigration-courts-insight/hasty-rollout-of-trump-immigration-policy-has-broken-border-courts-idUSKCN1VV115 …
